text.paragraph: Public Health Reporting Communication: one or more conditions are reportable, or may be reportable, to public health.

code.displayName: Initial case report processing information Document

text.paragraph: An initial report for a possible reportable condition was received on 20240729034706 with the file name 1.2.840.114350.1.13.478.2.7.8.688883.331587038. The eICR was processed with the warning of: outdated eRSD (RCTC) version.

code.displayName: eICR was processed - with a warning

value.displayName: The eICR was processed with the warning of: outdated eRSD (RCTC) version.

observation.value: The expected eRSD (RCTC) version should be one of the following: 2024-04-05,1.2.3.0,3.x.x

text.paragraph: Your organization electronically submitted an initial case report to determine if reporting to public health is needed for a patient.

"Syphilis (disorder)" is reportable to "Tennessee Department of Health". The initial case report was sent to "Tennessee Department of Health". Additional information may be required for this report."Viral hepatitis type C (disorder)" is reportable to "Tennessee Department of Health". The initial case report was sent to "Tennessee Department of Health". Additional information may be required for this report.
The trigger code version your organization is using is out-of-date. Please have your EHR administrators install the current version for complete eCR functioning.
Reporting is required within "1 Week(s)". Reporting to this Public Health Agency is based on "Patient home address"

paragraph.content: > Additional information for required disease reporting must be submitted to the Tennessee Department of Health within 1 week. This additional information can be found here. (Action requested)
> CDC website with STD treatment guidelines. (Information only)
"Viral hepatitis type C (disorder)" for "Tennessee Department of Health"

text.paragraph: Reporting is required within "1 Week(s)". Reporting to this Public Health Agency is based on "Patient home address"

paragraph.content: > If you have additional questions regarding disease reporting, the Tennessee Department of Health can be reached 615-741-7247. (Information only)
